item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Marilyn Monroe
item.description: "I'm selfish, impatient and a little insecure. I make mistakes, I am out of control and at times hard to handle. But if you can't handle me at my worst, then you sure as hell don't deserve me at my best." -- Marilyn Monroe

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Stella Gibbons
item.description: "One of the disadvantages of almost universal education was the fact that all kinds of persons acquired a familiarity with one's favorite writers. It gave one a curious feeling; it was like seeing a drunken stranger wrapped in one's dressing gown." -- Stella Gibbons

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by George Eliot
item.description: "It is never too late to be what you might have been." -- George Eliot

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Margaret Mitchell
item.description: "Life's under no obligation to give us what we expect." -- Margaret Mitchell

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Mae West
item.description: "You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough." -- Mae West

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Narcotics Anonymous
item.description: "Insanity is doing the same thing, over and over again, but expecting different results." -- Narcotics Anonymous

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Eleanor Roosevelt
item.description: "A woman is like a tea bag; you never know how strong it is until it's in hot water." -- Eleanor Roosevelt

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Mary Stewart
item.description: "Every life has death and every light has shadow. Be content to stand in the light and let the shadow fall where it will." -- Mary Stewart

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Charles Péguy
item.description: "A word is not the same with one writer as it is with another. One tears it from his guts. The other pulls it out of his overcoat pocket." -- Charles Péguy

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Mother Theresa of Calcutta
item.description: "It is a poverty to decide that a child must die so that you may live as you wish." -- Mother Theresa of Calcutta

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Mother Teresa
item.description: "Do not think that love, in order to be genuine, has to be extraordinary. What we need is to love without getting tired." -- Mother Teresa

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Robert Southey
item.description: "Give me a room whose every nook is dedicated to a book." -- Robert Southey

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Ron Rash
item.description: "But nothing is solid and permanent. Our lives are raised on the shakiest foundations. You don't need to read history books to know that. You only have to know the history of your own life." -- Ron Rash

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Ron Rash
item.description: "What made losing someone you loved bearable was not remembering but forgetting. Forgetting small things first... it's amazing how much you could forget, and everything you forgot made that person less alive inside you until you could finally endure it. After more time passed you could let yourself remember, even want to remember. But even then what you felt those first days could return and remind you the grief was still there, like old barbed wire embedded in a tree's heartwood." -- Ron Rash

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Julie Orringer
item.description: "Andras went through the Sortie doors and walked out into a city that no longer contained his brother. He walked on benumbed feet in the new black Oxfords his brother had brought him from Hungary. He didn’t care who passed him on the street or where he was going. If he had stepped off the curb into the air instead of down into the gutter, if he had climbed the void above the cars and between the buildings until he was looking down at the rooftops with their red-clay chimney pots, their irregular curving grid, and if he had then kept climbing until he was wading through the slough of low-lying clouds in the winter sky, he would have felt no shock or joy, no wonder or surprise, just the same leaden dampness in his limbs." -- Julie Orringer

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Julie Orringer
item.description: "Why would a man not argue his own shameful culpability, why would he not crave responsibility for disaster, when the alternative was to feel himself to be nothing more than a speck of human dust?" -- Julie Orringer

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Julie Orringer
item.description: "Sarah had a saying: Der gleichster veg iz ful mit shtainer." "What's it mean?" "The smoothest way is sometimes full of stones." -- Julie Orringer

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Julie Orringer
item.description: "He could see the inchworm in his mind even now, that snip of green elastic with it's tiny blunt legs, coiling and stretching its way toward the tabletop, on a mission whose nature was a mystery. Survival, he understood now - that was all. That contracting and straining, that frantic rearing-up to look around: It was nothing less than the urgent business of staying alive." -- Julie Orringer

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Richard Wright
item.description: "I would hurl words into this darkness and wait for an echo, and if an echo sounded, no matter how faintly, I would send other words to tell, to march, to fight, to create a sense of the hunger for life that gnaws in us all." -- Richard Wright

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Frank Zappa
item.description: "So many books, so little time." -- Frank Zappa

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "In your life there are a few places, or maybe only the one place, where something happened, and then there are all the other places." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "Why is it a surprise to find that people other than ourselves are able to tell lies?" -- Alice Munro

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "His face contained for me all possibilities of fierceness and sweetness, pride and submissiveness, violence, self-containment. I never saw more in it than I had when I saw it first, because I saw everything then. The whole thing in him that I was going to love, and never catch or explain." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "Always remember that when a man goes out of the room, he leaves everything in it behind... When a woman goes out she carries everything that happened in the room along with her." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Alice Munro
item.description: "It almost seemed as if there must be some random and of course unfair thrift in the emotional housekeeping of the world, if the great happiness--however temporary, however flimsy--of one person could come out of the great unhappiness of another." -- Alice Munro

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Lillian Hellman
item.description: "I cannot and will not cut my conscience to fit this year's fashions." -- Lillian Hellman

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Robert Graves
item.description: "There's no money in poetry, but there's no poetry in money, either." -- Robert Graves

item.title: Sarah Ryburn add a quote by Karen Russell i Vampires in the Lemon Grove i
item.description: "Samson had a knack for this kind of insight: he was like a grinning fisherman who could wrench a secret from the depths of your chest and dangle it in front of you, revealing it to be nothing but a common, mud–colored fish." -- Karen Russell i Vampires in the Lemon Grove i
